column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=There has always been tension between the governments of Greece and Turkey , some created by attempts to cover mistakes by both sides .
#Text=It is no coincidence that both are in dire straits financially .
#Text=It is an artificial thing created by [ the ] government[s ] .
#Text=Of course these things can escalate ; both Greece and Turkey have a policy of arms buildup .
#Text=We recently had the sledgehammer controversy in Turkey where they planned to create incidents within Greece in an effort to seize power .
#Text=Also , many high-ranking army officers have been prosecuted in Turkey for trying to seize power in a coup .
#Text=Why do you oppose the current austerity measures ?
#Text=What has the government , in your view , got so wrong ?
#Text=The government , in its effort to pay back banks and in fact to pay back interest on loans , has already paid in some cases twice the original loan at high interest rates .
#Text=They 're trying to grab as much money as they can and we know for a fact that ’s also on the orders of the Greek capitalist class .
#Text=They are reducing the worker ’s rights for more money and this actually leads to poverty .
#Text=Greece will be in guaranteed recession for two years and hopes then to create a 0.1 % GDP rise .
#Text=That will be very hard .
#Text=We know from a variety of statistics that the working class will be made to pay around 35 % of the current GDP .
#Text=Consuming will go to standstill so that in two years time debt will rise from 120 % of current GDP to 150 % GDP and people will suffer .
#Text=We know all the loans , just like the previous loans , will be siphoned off by business and will not go into Greek coffers .
#Text=It will go instead to lining the pockets of big business .
#Text=I have heard that people in Greece are upset that the euro has weakened Greece ’s economic position , as the Drachma ’ s low value actually encouraged spending by foreigners .
#Text=What steps would a socialist government take to encourage new spending in Greece by both foreign tourists and investors ?
#Text=A socialist government could actually work if other economies and other people would follow Greece ’s steps .
#Text=Greece would then be a self-sufficient economy and not need these investments .
#Text=Of course we once had these investments , through the tourism industry , and they did n’t work .
#Text=This is whether with the new currency of the euro or the old .
#Text=The government is seriously thinking of relapse right now which would be a disaster because it would be so devalued .
#Text=It would possibly even go into a tailspin of devaluation .
#Text=The possibilities are grossly underestimated in Greece and not enough investments are made in these possibilities .
